meanings.definition: To direct or divert (something) in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent1: She kept mischanneling the water hose, spraying it everywhere except the plants.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was mischanneling the oil, causing the engine to malfunction.
meanings.sent3: The magician's mischanneling of the rabbit into the hat left the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her mischanneling of emotions led to a storm of misunderstandings in the office.
meanings.sent5: The mischanneling of traffic by the confused officer created chaos on the road.

meanings.definition: The act of sending or transmitting (something) incorrectly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: The mischanneling of the email resulted in important information being lost.
meanings.sent2: He realized the mischanneling of the radio signal when the message came out garbled.
meanings.sent3: The mischanneling of the TV broadcast made the weather report sound like a comedy show.
meanings.sent4: The mischanneling of the package caused it to be delivered to the wrong address.
meanings.sent5: The mischanneling of the instructions led to a disastrous outcome.
